input: Covid-19 has impacted the global economy significantly. Many businesses had to adapt to new ways of operating. Remote work became the new normal.
output:
During Covid-19, many countries faced significant impacts on their economies. As a result, numerous enterprises were forced to adjust how they conducted business operations. Consequently, working from home transformed into the standard mode of operation.

Many businesses had bounced back and adopted new operational models in response. The transition was not without challenges; nonetheless, it facilitated a smoother adaptation to remote work environments.

All these changes ultimately marked the beginning of a period where remote working became an integral part of how companies functioned, transforming both daily operations and future strategies.
